question.body: Hydrogen bonding is responsible for each of the following except:

multiple_choice.choice: the high surface tension of water.
the three dimensional structure of water-soluble macromolecules.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Although 5 kcal/mol seems low, the sum of all hydrogen bonds at the surface of water is very large.
Incorrect. Hydrogen bonding does stabilize the three-dimensional structure of water-soluble macromolecules.
Incorrect. Polar molecules are able to integrate into the hydrogen bonding network of water.
covalent bonds are much stronger than hydrogen bonds. Usually a covalent bond is considered a ‘permanent’ linkage and a hydrogen bond is used for stabilization.

part.hint: Hydrogen bonds are used for inter-molecular interactions: water-water, water-macromolecule, etc.
